extendedIngredients.name: pepper sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 tsp hot pepper sauce, to taste

extendedIngredients.name: rainbow trout
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb raw rainbow trout , skinless,cut into four pieces

title: Cornmeal Breaded Trout
summary: Cornmeal Breaded Trout might be a good recipe to expand your main course recipe box. This recipe makes 1 servings with 1125 calories, 121g of protein, and 24g of fat each. For $8.86 per serving, this recipe covers 59% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 9 minutes. Head to the store and pick up skim milk, pepper sauce, egg whites, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the skim milk you could follow this main course with the Homemade Skim Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Overall, this recipe earns a spectacular spoonacular score of 93%. Similar recipes include Cornmeal Breaded Trout, Cornmeal-Crusted Trout, and Cook the Book: Cornmeal-Crusted Pan-Fried Trout.
instructions: Spray a large skillet with olive oil-flavored cooking spray; set aside.In a large shallow dish, combine egg whites, milk, Creole seasoning and pepper sauce.Whisk egg whites until frothy.Blend in cornmeal; add trout fillets turning to coat.Set skillet over medium-high heat.When pan is hot, spray trout with cooking spray and cook sprayed-side down, 2 minutes.Spray side-facing up with cooking spray and turn fillets.Cook until fish pulls apart when tested with a fork, 1 to 2 more minutes.Serve with lemon wedges and extra hot sauce on the side.

steps.step: Spray a large skillet with olive oil-flavored cooking spray; set aside.In a large shallow dish, combine egg whites, milk, Creole seasoning and pepper sauce.

Whisk egg whites until frothy.Blend in cornmeal; add trout fillets turning to coat.Set skillet over medium-high heat.When pan is hot, spray trout with cooking spray and cook sprayed-side down, 2 minutes.Spray side-facing up with cooking spray and turn fillets.Cook until fish pulls apart when tested with a fork, 1 to 2 more minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges and extra hot sauce on the side.
